metadata.title: CVE-2020-1712 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A heap use-after-free vulnerability was found in systemd before versionv245-rc1, where asynchronous Polkit queries are performed while handlingdbus messages. A local unprivileged attacker can abuse this flaw to crashsystemd services or potentially execute code and elevate their privileges,by sending specially crafted dbus messages.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-1712` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 229-4ubuntu21.27
libnss-mymachines - 229-4ubuntu21.27
libnss-resolve - 229-4ubuntu21.27
libpam-systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.27
libsystemd0 - 229-4ubuntu21.27
libudev1 - 229-4ubuntu21.27
systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.27
systemd-container - 229-4ubuntu21.27
systemd-coredump - 229-4ubuntu21.27
systemd-journal-remote - 229-4ubuntu21.27
systemd-sysv - 229-4ubuntu21.27
udev - 229-4ubuntu21.27
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '229-4ubuntu21.27').
